Content: *p71888a01832*18	  	 *(e)	 vanadium(v) ions, vo2+ , in acidic solution may be reduced step by step through its oxidation states.		compare and contrast the use of iron and tin in this reduction process.		include equations and ecell values for any reactions that occur.		state symbols are not required.(6)		use only data from these tables.		vanadium systemselectrode systeme  / v                         v3+(aq)   +   e–      v2+(aq)–0.26vo2+(aq)   +   2h+(aq)   +   e–      v3+(aq)   +   h2o(l)+0.34 vo2+(aq)   +   2h+(aq)   +   e–      vo2+(aq)   +   h2o(l)+1.00		reducing agentselectrode systeme  / vfe2+(aq)   +   2e–      fe(s)–0.44sn2+(aq)   +   2e–      sn(s)–0.14
